job_title: Director, Product Management, Google for Clinicians Care Studio
job_Description: Minimum qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience  15 years of experience in product management, including 5 years in healthcare technology or a related industry  Experience leading products in regulated ecosystems Preferred qualifications:  10 years of experience in environments with product strategy, tactics, and execution, delivering technology products to health enterprises with clinician products  Experience leading teams, building and growing talent, and creating a sense of purpose and positive culture  Experience with legal, policy, regulatory, and/or public relations groups  Ability to raise awareness, drive alignment with internal and external stakeholders, create a sense of urgency across teams, and create innovative leading vision  Technical background and understanding of assistive and ML-based experiences  Excellent communication and presentation skills  About the job Google is looking to transform health by empowering consumers and their caregivers with the information and tools they need for a healthier life. We are a rapidly growing cross-functional organization that combines machine learning, innovative product development, and engineering in a variety of healthcare areas.  Google for Clinicians is an information layer on top of traditional electronic medical record systems, that helps clinicians find and understand critical information, giving them insights about their patients, powered by our AI advances. Our goal is to become an enterprise suite for health systems looking to get control of their data and provide tools for their front-line clinicians and their back-office analysts, while creating interoperability and access to data for patients and their families. Developing, deploying, operating, and scaling the system requires the creation of several key technical and business systems, including productization of the data platform itself, continued development of clinician-facing tools, investment and development of prediction AI systems, and the enterprise deployment harness needed to support and scale customers. As the Director of Product Management for the Care Studio team, you will be responsible for working with cross-functional executives to develop the core strategy, lay the plans for development and execution, grow a talented team, engage clients and the industry, and drive product success. Google Health has made major advances in healthcare research, such as detecting eye disease more quickly and accurately than experts, planning cancer radiotherapy treatment in seconds rather than hours, and working to detect patient deterioration before it happens with electronic records.  Fundamental research is at the core of Google Health - the multidisciplinary team collaborates with partners to publish novel research in renowned scientific journals. They then work to apply this research into the medical field through clinical hardware and products developed in Google. Working alongside colleagues across Google, you’ll help make this vision a reality. Responsibilities  Work cross-functionally to develop Google’s strategy and roadmap in healthcare and develop disruptive business models and ecosystems to transform the healthcare industry. Build AI-powered clinical information and workflow systems that raise the quality of healthcare by bringing underlying information to light, help move medicine from reactive to predictive, and assists doctors in spending more time with patients and their families. Mentor attract, and retain product managers who can grow, thrive, and have impact. Develop a unique approach to research. Plan, launch, land, and iterate health technology applications that are safe, secure, and performant, but also agile and iterative. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Our Company Automat Solutions, Inc. develops a transformative approach to simplify advanced material Research and Development (R&D) and to accelerate Time to Market (TTM), with a current focus on battery material development. The approach consists of a Materials AI Robotics-driven System (MARS) that is purposefully built for R&D, combining machine learning and robotic high-throughput automation. Promising to solve one of the biggest struggles of material innovation—lengthy TTM—it cuts the discovery time for new material solutions drastically by ten times. The company’s vision is to employ an autonomous centralized facility with AI and Robotics as the foundation for material innovation, education, and commercialization. Location Fremont, CA About the Team All core team members earned Doctoral degrees from directly relevant fields, with a combined multidisciplinary experience of tens of years with battery materials, high throughput platforms, machine learning and business development, respectively. Recently, we were awarded competitive grants from the National Science Foundation and the Department of Energy. Moreover, we are partnering with industrial leaders. What to Expect Witness and contribute to materials innovation by taking advantage of cutting-edge machine learning and robotics. Currently, Automat Solutions is an early-stage startup. Gain entrepreneurial experience while earning the opportunity to shape company’s future. Work closely with a team, including the executives, to execute project tasks related to machine learning. This includes but is not limited to the following: 1. Design, develop and test machine learning methods for predicting material properties. 2. Design, develop and test methods (such as reinforcement learning and Bayesian optimization) for searching optimal material recipes. 3. Work with team members to adapt and optimize the above methods into the battery material development workflow. 4. Manage projects from start to finish. Capable of performing detailed machine learning work independently. 5. Perform routine machine learning maintenance and upgrade. Requirements 1. BS/MS degree in computer science, data science or related disciplines is required along with 2+ years experience. 2. Strong Python and SQL skills and demonstrated experience with libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, and Scikit-learn. 3. Experience with AI/ML techniques such as regression/classification modeling, reinforcement learning, and feature selection/engineering. Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch a plus. 4. Database management experience with MySQL, NoSQL, etc. 5. Able to transform complex data to easily communicate insights, detect trends, and present visualizations 6. Clear and effective communication skills with an ability to adapt to new situations 7. Familiarity with automated workflows and equipment is a plus. Work Location: One location Work Remotely No Job Type: Full-time Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Machine Learning: 2 years (Preferred) Python: 2 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location

The Opportunity  Reporting to the Director of Threat Intelligence, this role will be heavily involved in hunting for notable phishing attacks that will feed the team's research and support external content production. You will also support the development of a resource dedicated to sharing intelligence about email-based attacks with the cybersecurity community. In this position, you will also actively research various types of cyber attacks using active defense techniques, data analysis, and open source intelligence gathering.   Who you are  Naturally curious, always wanting to know more about a problem  Self-directed, detail-oriented problem solver with demonstrated experience in developing and improving processes  Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and manage workloads effectively  Anticipate team needs, able to flex and stretch to meet changing business demands  Ability to collaborate is a must, but you will be autonomous and expected to succeed without a ton of direction  Default to action; taking initiative and follow-through is a must  Committed to our core principles and mission; you are in demonstration of them daily   What you'll do  Hunt through internal and external data sources to identify new and interesting phishing attacks to support team's research mission and external intelligence content  Engage with phishing attacks and attackers to collect intelligence about the full cycle of email-based attacks  Maintain up-to-date knowledge base of phishing email examples for public consumption  Conduct data analysis to identify emerging phishing trends  Analyze BEC emails to understand new tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)  Conduct open source research to collect intelligence from underground forums, dark web blogs, and other communication platforms, such as Telegram and WhatsApp  Collaborate with internal teams to support intelligence collection   Experience you'll need  Passion for helping solve big problems and working with a wide variety of teams to make an impact  Ability to digest raw intelligence and produce well-written basic analytical products  Experience analyzing email-based threats, particularly business email compromise attacks  Understanding of social engineering techniques and phishing threats  Previous experience with data analysis tools  Strong analytical reasoning, problem solving, and decision making skills  Ability to work independently and effectively as part of a remote team with minimal supervision   More About Abnormal Security  Abnormal Security is defining the next generation of email security defense. Our platform uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to baseline communication content, user identity, and behavioral signals in real-time and at-scale in order to detect the abnormalities of email attacks. Customers love us because we consistently detect and stop what everyone else in the market can't - advanced attacks that have never been seen before - and we do so with beautiful user interfaces and best-in-industry customer support.   Our veteran team has built some of the most enduring machine learning platforms at leading companies including Google, Twitter, Pinterest, Amazon, Microsoft, and Expanse. We are located in San Francisco, CA, New York, NY, and Lehi, UT.   Our company is growing - we're on the Forbes AI 50, selected as a Gartner 2020 Cool Vendor, and our customer base includes multiple Fortune 500 companies.   Abnormal Security is committed to creating a diverse work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

About NEXT  NEXT was founded with a vision to implement solutions and bring change to a fragmented industry. As a FreightTech pioneer, we are designing technology-driven solutions to transform the $800B U.S. shipping & trucking industry. Our platform connects shippers with freight capacity for every step of a shipment's journey.  NEXT is a company driven by a commitment to provide world-class service to shippers and truckers alike. We're on a mission to solve a trillion dollar puzzle and make freight painless.  Armed with experienced professionals from Google, Amazon, Airbnb and Uber, NEXT is seeking change agents who are excited to make a meaningful impact on an industry driving the U.S. economy. We have been recognized as one of Built in LA's Best Small Companies to Work For and 50 Startups to Watch. NEXT is venture-backed by leaders such as Sequoia Capital, GLP and Brookfield Ventures.   About The Role:  The mission of the Machine Learning (ML) team at NEXT is to build and deliver business critical ML solutions. As a key member of the ML team you will work on a broad range of business/technical problems and technologies, build machine learning models, and design/automate/deploy production machine learning pipelines. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Next, you will have the opportunity to make an outsized impact on the future direction of our ML platform. The problem domains you will work on will be diverse and include pricing, smart routing and user modeling. You should be comfortable and effective working remotely or with remote team members. To be successful, in addition to a strong technical background, you must also be an excellent communicator in all dimensions: able to truly listen and understand the most important challenges across the engineering org, while also being a champion and evangelist for the right technical solutions.   Senior Machine Learning Engineer   What You'll Do:  Design, build, automate, deploy and maintain machine learning production pipelines.  Implement machine learning model lifecycle management, including automated model performance evaluation and retraining.  Work with large amounts of structured and unstructured data.  Build ML models to solve critical business needs across core domains.  Help develop the next generation of Next's proprietary pricing engine.  Integrate state of the art industry tools into Next's ML platform  Collaborate with other engineering teams to integrate machine learning into the wider Next technology platform.  Write clear technical documentation and communicate processes and results effectively, both at the team level as well as across the company..   Your Experience Might Include:   5+ years relevant engineering work experience.  BS Degree in Computer Science or related field; with project experience in machine learning and/or statistical modeling.  Working knowledge of databases and SQL.  Experience creating ML and/or data pipelines.  Development experience in Python is strongly preferred.  Knowledge of common machine learning concepts, frameworks and libraries.  Experience working with public cloud. AWS (strongly preferred), GCP, Azure.  Track record of leading initiatives and working autonomously.  Strong communications skills, and ability to influence/educate across the entire org.  Bonus points for experience with:  Pipeline automation tools like Airflow.  Previous experience with applying ML to problems in logistics, pricing, routing, recommendation engines or similar projects.  What you'll get:  Competitive Base Salary + Equity  Full Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits  401K w/ company match  Vacation and Holidays  Join a rapidly growing technology company disrupting the trucking industry

Research Scientist – Spectroscopy Picarro is the world's leading provider of gas concentration and stable isotope measurement systems for science and industry. The company's products are designed and manufactured at Picarro's Santa Clara, CA headquarters. We are seeking a Research Scientist to help drive development of the next generation of laser-based analytical instrumentation capable of high precision, high accuracy molecular analysis of complex gas mixtures. The Research Scientist will be responsible for helping to execute an experimental program in support of the development and manufacture of our analytical instrumentation. As part of this work, the Research Scientist will develop and deploy software tools for collecting, analyzing, and visualizing the results of the experiments performed in the R&D or manufacturing organization. We are looking for an innovative experimental scientist with extensive programming experience; who understands the challenges of collecting and interpreting scientific data; is adept at managing, analyzing, and displaying large amounts of these data; and is capable of developing a deep understanding of Picarro’s core technology and the hybrid hardware / software algorithms that run on the instruments. Competence in broad variety of data analysis, regression, and reduction techniques such as curve fitting (linear and non-linear methods) and statistical analysis is required. Responsibilities:  The ideal Research Scientist candidate is an experienced Experimental Scientist who will Design and run rigorous experimental programs and test stations as part of the Picarro technical team Build sophisticated analysis software to collect, process, analyze, visualize, and report the results of the experimental tests. Analyze complex experimental data, synthesize conclusions, and report findings to the Research and Engineering Teams. Work with other members of the Research, Hardware, Software, Manufacturing, and Product Marketing teams to execute on our ambitious product development programs. Education Required:  MS required, Ph.D. preferred in Physics, Applied Physics, Chemistry, Engineering, or related field. Requirements:  Excellent Laboratory Skills, including data acquisition system design, and expertise in Scientific Data Analysis and Visualization, including algorithmic development, is required. Expert proficiency in python programming required; hands-on experience with industry standard SW development best practices strongly preferred. Experience with machine learning techniques and/or chemometrics highly desired. Ability to manage, process, and visualize large amounts of scientific data quickly. Independently Motivated / Technical Leader. Able to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, to a diverse range of audiences (peers, staff, management, collaborators, etc.) and skill levels (novice to expert). About Picarro:  Picarro is pioneering a unique confluence of hardware, software and cloud-based computing unlike anything being done today. By manufacturing the precision instruments at the core of this technology as well as developing the algorithms that enable cogent information to be derived from the data, we are transforming how world-class scientific, industrial and regulatory compliance measurements are made, and more importantly, who makes them. Infrared optical spectroscopy is a proven technology for delivering precise, real-time measurement of the constituents in a gas stream with high sensitivity and selectivity. Recent developments in laser technology allow for a very significant increase in the number of species that can be measured simultaneously, leading to an unprecedented increase in the amount of information that can be collected and to corresponding challenges in extracting information from the results. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, gender identity, social orientation, nor on the basis of disability. Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals. Job Type: Full-time

Because we live to sanctify time, we've gone ahead and provided   the answers to the questions we think you should be asking us .  For more details, read on!  About the Company:  We all waste a staggering amount of time (~33%) because we have no idea where we are spending it. Worse yet, we continue to operate in a factory model that simply does not apply to creative work. Our big bet is that by understanding time, we'll be able to move away from it as a unit of value. In the future knowledge economy (lawyers, accountants, engineers), contributions will be assessed on value added, not the underlying time spent adding it.  Ambitious mission to say the least, so where are we starting? We have created a new market category called  Time Automation  that automates the timekeeping process for professionals and allows us to collect time data at scale. Before TBP, professionals had to manually record every six minutes of their day into antiquated timekeeping software. Not anymore.  We are a Series B company (>$55M in venture capital from Tier 1 funds) that has assembled some of the best builders, designers, and product minds in tech—and we all have one thing in common: we are deeply motivated by our mission  to return time .  We need to find like-minded colleagues who want to join us on our journey and are willing to spend their time solving time. It will be a long road but if we're even half right, we'll change the way work is measured and performed forever.  About the Role:  Come lead our Product Automation Strategy and use of ML to return human time as our Director of Engineering for Machine Learning. This role is responsible for creating a system that fundamentally understands how people work, then applying this the problem we are solving today of shortening the time users spend converting work activities into timesheets to deliver on our promise to help timekeepers bill more time,  in   less time.  While we build out our burgeoning ML group, this role requires you to develop short and mid term strategy, recruiting of a world class engineering team, and relentless product execution by bringing real-world use of machine learning and coupling it in a consumer-grade software experience for enterprise customers.  As the first leadership hire dedicated to this core company function, you will set the culture and approach — boldly differentiating us from our competition and stirring the imagination of the many customers we serve and will serve tomorrow on the possibilities of Time Automation for their industries (yes, beyond legal).  You will be responsible for a full stack team that will include the data storage and processing infrastructure, the cleansing and analysis of the data, model creation and delivery, integration of those models into backend services and the presentation layer, and regular feedback telemetry monitoring for in-field performance. You will be broadly empowered to make both the technology selections and engineering process decisions to optimally deliver.  Core Duties:  Build, own, and drive our Automation strategy and technology, and in particular our Machine Learning and other Predictive Services work to help minimize time and effort for timesheet creation.  Collaborate with the Design team to create a design language that helps our users understand how TBP works for them, demystifying the automation.  Lead our Engineering efforts to develop a world class infrastructure and pipeline for data, machine learning, and model management that allows us to improve the product at blistering speed (model creation, management, and deployment).  Deliver regular releases of models and service releases to improve the products automation capabilities.  Collaborate with Sales, Product Marketing, and Customer Success so they effectively speak to our automation capabilities for their stakeholders, driving product sales and adoption.  Maintain a strong understanding of customer behavior, the competitive landscape, and industry trends and meet with our stakeholders regularly.  Develop our forward strategy with data and new products we can create and sell.  Core Teammates:  VP of Engineering (direct manager)  Product Lead, Automation Experience (peer, reporting into VP of Product)  Design Lead, Automation Experience (peer, reporting into Head of Design)  Data Scientist (direct report)  Data Scientist (direct report)  Team Growth Plan:  Product Lead, Automation (peer, hiring immediately)  Design Lead, Automation (peer, hiring immediately)  Data Engineer (direct report, hiring immediately)  Sr. Software Engineer, Automation (direct report, hiring immediately)  Skills and Experience:  Qualifications and experience we're looking for:   At least 9 years of software engineering and engineering management experience  Expert in Machine Learning model creation, management, and deployment  Expert in technology selection for building and operating data processing systems  Experience building products or services from scratch  Nice to Haves :  Experience building end to end machine learning enabled software, with consumer experience  B2B software (SaaS), particularly AI-based  Flexibility and Logistics:  Location : Fully remote, or in our offices (San Francisco or Los Angeles, CA). If you're close to our SF or LA offices, we'd love to have you into the office at least once a week once it's safe (targeting 2022).  Compensation:  Competitive salary, generous equity, comprehensive medical/dental/vision coverage with covered premiums, 401(k), additional benefits including wellness/commuter/FSA stipends.  Visa Sponsorship:  Unfortunately we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.  What happens if my kid or I are sick on a workday?  Take all the time you need! We'll cover for you. And send you some soup.  The Hiring Process:  Phone conversation with principal recruiter (30 min.)  Video interview with CTO (45 min.)  Video interview with VP of Product (45 min.)  Video interview panel (4 eng x 45 min. in 2 days)  Offer!   At Time by Ping, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who think rigorously and aren't afraid to challenge the status quo. If you're interested in joining us on our mission to return time, then we encourage you to apply, even if you don't perfectly match every single bullet on the job description. Time by Ping is an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment, free from discrimination or harassment, for all employees.

Totus Medicines, an innovative therapeutic drug discovery biotech, is just emerging from stealth. With a $40M Series A, Totus is poised to revolutionize drug discovery. For the first time, Totus is enabling genome-scale drug discovery to allow the identification of precision medicines for hard-to-drug targets. At its core, Totus is a chemical biology company. Totus' novel proprietary platform allows screening at a rate more than 100,000 times faster than competitive technologies. Totus has pioneered the development of selective medicines for patients with genetically defined cancers and plans for its first program to enter Phase I by end of 2022. Totus also plans to expand their platform to create therapeutics targeted at neurodegeneration, infectious diseases, and others. We are searching for talented, passionate, high-energy candidates to join our growing team. We are looking for a highly talented and motivated Machine Learning and AI Scientist from the world of academics or industry to join Totus to help build a world-class data science platform to drive forward medical discoveries to help save lives. You will be part of a dynamic organization and therefore you should be comfortable in a "building-mode" biotech setting where you will shape the company's scientific strategy, culture, and mission.   How You Will Contribute   Build a strategy for a ML platform for Totus life science data.  Collaborate with key stakeholders, including other data scientists, biologists and chemists to understand, interpret datasets and apply the best ML methods.  Design and implement data preprocessing, integration, and analysis solutions.  Partner with the Platform Software Engineering team to build and deploy production analysis tools in the Cloud.  Designing new algorithms to find predictive patterns that combine heterogeneous data assets, including sequential user events data, unstructured text, and knowledge graph.   What You Bring   MS or PhD or equivalent in a quantitative field, e.g., physics, math, computer science.  Demonstrated machine learning expertise with a solid publication and citation record.  Proven track record of applying ML methods to large datasets.  Experience in graph data, sparse data, generative and discriminative data modeling and geometric deep learning and neural networks (CNN, GNN, GAN etc.)  Knowledge of life science chemical (e.g. molecular descriptors) and biological (e.g. genomics sequence) data.  A deep desire to use data science to affect human lives and bring novel therapies to patients in need.  A curiosity to learn, takes initiative, has a bias for action, and a problem-solving attitude, along with high personal standards of reliability and a track record of driving projects to completion.  Tech Stack capabilities including, but not limited to, python, R, Snowflake.  The ability to work lean and in an agile research environment  What We Offer   A knowledgeable, high-achieving, experienced and fun team   A diverse work atmosphere   The chance to be part of a growing startup and the next success story   The opportunity to shape our company culture   Constant learning and dynamic challenges to help you grow and be the best version of yourself

job_title: Sr. Research Operations Manager - Opportunity for Working Remotely Palo Alto, CA
job_Description: The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity? Some critical sources of job satisfaction include the people you work with, the impact you may have, and the intellectual merits of the work you do. The responsibilities associated with this role will span programs that range from speculative academic explorations to ‘moon-shot’ technology projects within the office of the CTO. You will engage with thought-leading faculty, star students, and VMware’s emerging technical leaders – people who as a rule are inspiring, technologically daring, driven, and collegially collaborative. If we are jointly successful, we will create technology options and new lines of business for VMware and advance the state of the art in computing. The role itself must also be a great fit. The person who fills this role will operationalize and operate programs that foster innovation in R&D. You delight in creating the environment that allows technologists and developers to focus on their main expertise, yet within parameters that maximize success through systematic attention to the “full surround” of a bold research idea – project management, stakeholder engagement, internal and external marketing, financial planning, human resources, legal support, reporting, and recordkeeping. You delight in building and operating organizational infrastructure that helps people and teams be successful, and you clear obstacles and improve the company’s system when you encounter things that don’t make sense. You are able to work through others and leverage the talents of specialized groups across VMware to help your teams succeed. You know that research projects are unpredictable, and that flexibility is imperative as progress unfolds. You are exceptionally well-organized, and you are able to juggle multiple, competing priorities without fail. Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing? Ensure the operational excellence of VMware Research Group (VRG), developing and managing the systems and processes that help enable the business to run smoothly and effectively. Recruiting - partnering with key stakeholders to source, hire, and on-board employees, including interns, post docs, SiRs (Scholars in Residence) /ARs (Affiliated Researchers) and permanent employees. PR/Communications - Communicate the impact of VRG’s work (including VRG Israel) on VMware to both, other parts of VMware and the outside world. Strengthen cross-collaboration and partner with research incubation and academic programs as well as other relevant groups within OCTO and VMware. IT - Partner with IT in machine lease/purchases, infrastructure monitoring. Legal - collaboration and visitor agreements & negotiating IP Remote/Distributed Teams: Continue to find unique ways to build team relationships while remote. Intern Program - recruiting, onboarding, visa paperwork, orientation, talk scheduling and making sure they have a terrific summer with us, including networking opportunities. Finance – quarterly reporting and tracking spend DEI Thought Leadership - Ensure VRG leads in DEI best practices for recruiting and hiring. Exceed on OCTO and R&ET DEI goals. Partner with OCTO on piloting programs. The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis? As a Research Operations Program Manager, you will help organize R&D teams and projects for success in all non-technical respects. The challenge includes both defining and helping to operate moonshot projects and our academic collaborations by organizing, tracking, and reporting on a to-be determined mixture of: Stakeholder engagement (organizing periodic briefings, monthly reports, etc.) Project execution (creating a cadence of progress with urgency, defining and tracking progress, overcoming obstacles, etc) Internal and external marketing (publications, internal and external conference marketing collateral, internal and external web site management, etc.) Drive Business Rhythm (strategic planning to include academic, corporate calendars, including cadence of HR and fiscal events) Staffing (working with project leads and HR to ramp teams with urgency, track/support career growth) Intern Program Management (Recruiting, hiring, on-boarding, networking events, etc.) Finance (budget tracking, etc.) Event management (organizing and supporting representation conferences and tradeshows, organizing seminars and conferences including both internal and external participants), morale events. Legal (compliance, disclosures, NDAs, etc) Record keeping and provenance Skills: Experience running complex pieces of multiple large and small projects and programs Experience with project management tools. Experience with cutting-edge research project management, and with research culture, highly desirable. Experience with operations and organizational design Strong analytical skills. The ideal candidate should be able to make reasoned decisions in the face of uncertainty or imperfect data. Excellent written and verbal communication skills through all methods (email, social media, fact-to-face, leading meetings, etc.). . Some travel may be required to get to know the team and for team events. Diplomacy and the ability to influence people at all levels across a broad variety of job functions. Excellent organizational skills to juggle many tasks without losing sight of the highest priority tasks. Results oriented and driven. Creative and agile. What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like? You will be joining the Research team. The 50+ person team is comprised of Researchers, Academic Visitors, Interns, Post-Docs, Managers, and Operations. The team’s epicenter is Palo Alto, CA and spread throughout VMware offices including Austin, TX, Seattle, WA, Boston, MA and Israel. The research team has a culture of technical excellence and is growing from its early focus on systems research to include theory and a broader set of technical domains. The team culture is one based on building trust, on-going development through coaching, and giving back to the community. We trust each other to get the job done right, which allows for a flexible schedule to balance work and life. Where is this role located? Flexible: The location of this role is flexible within the U.S. Work will be done from an office some days during a week and other days from a non-VMware building. What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware? You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com. Employee Stock Purchase Plan Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types Generous Time Off Programs 40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.) Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes This job may require the candidate to comply with travel restrictions and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry. Category :  Business Strategy and Operations  Subcategory:  Program Management  Experience:  Business Leadership  Full Time/ Part Time:  Full Time  Posted Date:  2022-01-23 VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

We are a Series D company that’s on a mission to make hospitals more efficient with data science and machine learning. 110+ health systems and 400+ hospitals, across 40 states, rely on our award-winning products to increase patient access, decrease wait times, and reduce healthcare delivery costs. We have raised more than $250 million from top-tier investors such as Insight Partners and Goldman Sachs. We have been named among the top 100 AI companies in the world. You will be a Product Manager for the Analyze module of the iQueue for Operating Rooms product at LeanTaaS. This product is responsible for providing state-of-the-art analytics to hospital leaders to enable them in making data-driven decisions. You will be working with a cross-functional team made up of developers, product designers, QA, and data analysts. You will work closely with the rest of the iQueue for ORs product managers. This role requires a combination of deep technical skills, business acumen and interpersonal skills. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager with an entrepreneurial spirit who is looking for an opportunity to shape the direction of a massively influential tool for healthcare. You should thrive in an environment where you are granted a high level of trust and autonomy where direct instructions are rare. You should have experience in the healthcare industry and a strong understanding of the nature of healthcare work. Please note that while this role is listed as available for remote, we are currently employing in the following states: AK, AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, IL, IN, MA, MD, MI, MO, NC, NH, OH, PA, SC, TX, VA, WA. If your state is not listed, we may not be able to proceed with your application. We have offices in Santa Clara, CA and Charlotte, NC for employees who prefer to work regularly or occasionally from an office. WHAT YOU’LL DO Build a deep understanding of customer needs and pain-points, traveling on-site when necessary Analyze metrics, customer feedback, internal stakeholder feedback, and market trends to identify the highest value opportunities Act as the “glue” for a team of talented designers, developers, and other roles including data science, marketing, etc. Hit measurable and specific goals tied to short, medium, and long-term business outcomes Own the prioritization of the roadmap and backlog and make it visible to the rest of the company Manage projects from definition all the way through to release and implementation Collaborate with data scientists to integrate ML and AI tools into the product Provide the necessary context to the team so that they can quickly make reasonably good decisions Shield the team from requests and interruptions, while managing external stakeholders and keeping everyone in the loop Delight our customers and make sure we are always improving the product experience WHAT YOU’LL BRING Minimum 3 years of experience in product management where you were responsible for the product roadmap Experience in the healthcare or health-tech industries Experience working with data science models preferred Strong analytical skills and problem solving skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills and experience working with cross functional teams WHAT YOU'LL GET Intellectual and emotional satisfaction of solving tough operational problems in healthcare while improving patient access and saving lives! Competitive compensation package that includes base salary, annual bonus, and RSUs 401(k) Match Comprehensive healthcare benefits Generous Paid Time Off and Parental Leave Monthly reimbursement for Skill Building Monthly reimbursement for Wellness, Transportation, and/or Home Office Education Reimbursement for select courses/programs #LI-REMOTE LeanTaaS is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting an inclusive work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We value diversity, inclusion, and aim to provide a sense of belonging for everyone. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. If you require assistance during the application process, please reach out to accommodations@leantaas.com. LeanTaaS will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law. Please note: LeanTaaS is not accepting agency resumes at this time, and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Thank you. Job Type: Full-time

About this opportunity: Conduct functional and technical analysis to identify, validate, and implement Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning driven solutions and with strategic customers to understand Machine Intelligence (MI) driven business needs and opportunities. What you will do:  Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solutions to address needs. Work with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and propose/select/test predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical models, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems. Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones. Collaborate to design, develop, and deploy algorithms that have direct impact on millions of users to improve mobile network coverage. Industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents. Develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies and techniques for cross functional initiatives. Implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability. Understand, design, and develop heuristics and/or machine learning algorithms with telecom network configuration related datasets. Find relevant metrics and measurements for evaluating model performance based on the established success criteria. Conduct customer/stakeholder interviews to arrive at problem definition and value proposition. Perform Agile life cycle methodology. Build and develop performant, maintainable, and scalable data pipelines to parse terabytes of data. You will bring:  Masters degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science or a related field and at least 1 graduate-level course involving each of the following: programming languages (C++, Scala, Java, R, or Python); machine learning methods and frameworks; statistical methods using descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis; and Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, or Cassandra). Why Join Ericsson?  At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next. LI-POST Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more. If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.dallas@ericsson.com. or  (866) 374-2272  (US) or (877) 338-9966 (Canada) for further assistance. JOB TITLE:   Analyst Sale Analytics & Data Management DEPARTMENT:  Worldwide Distribution REPORTING TO:  Sr Manager, Sales Analytics & Data Management LOCATION:  Culver City Our Team Worldwide Television Distribution is based in Culver City and responsible for licensing features, series and formats to linear and digital platforms worldwide. The team has a very open and collaborative culture with a focus on individual development and innovation. Senior leadership of the team is highly accessible and fosters growth. The working environment is enriched by the mix of talent from sales, engineering, business development and management consulting. The LA based Sales Analytics and Insights team collaborates with teams globally and focuses on both local and international projects. The Role The Analyst must have advanced knowledge of Excel and have the aptitude to quickly learn SQL and other BI tools (e.g. Tableau and Altyerx). The candidate must have a curious mindset, with an impeccable attention to detail and passion for problem-solving. This role is a great opportunity to learn about the television distribution sales business and the analytics and data science beyond the deal making. The Analyst’s primary responsibility will be to ensure the robustness of the monthly data ingested by the internal IT teams and develop methods to provide confidence in the data quality. In addition, he/she will assist with analytics and insights including deal analysis bringing together deal/licensing nuances, performance data and market dynamics. Analysis will involve excel modelling and data visualizations tools. This role operates at the intersection of advanced analytics, business intelligence and data systems and as such, the candidate must have a passion for analytics and data. Experience diving into analytical problems and synthesizing disparate data sources is required. Experience in analytics, coding, and/or a basic understanding of machine learning algorithms, data science concepts and SQL are a plus. The Responsibilities  Data Management (50%) Assist with the validation of monthly customer statement ingests to ensure quality reporting used for performance analysis for SVOD and AVOD. Work with IT to improve ETL processes and data quality by having a great attention to detail. Recommend changes to the data structures to improve efficiency and speed of various Tableau dashboards. Analytics & Insights (50%) Assist with complex analysis involving multiple data sets, algorithms/heuristics that capture the complexities and nuances in licensing deals and normalizing performance data. Create excel models for performance analysis and use data science techniques where applicable to enhance analysis. Business sense check the outputs of analysis and incorporate market dynamics leveraging the nuances of TV Distribution business. Create and maintain insightful Tableau dashboards. Provide advanced visualization and dashboard customizations to business users. Conduct monthly analysis such as competitive analysis to provide inputs to senior leadership for strategy formulation. Contribute to the bespoke analysis and insights for deals. Present the insights and visualizations to sales teams and help drive business decisions. Qualifications: Education and Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Business Management, Finance, Economics or relevant field is strongly preferred. A minimum of 1-2 years relevant experience is required. Experience in TV distribution, sales planning or related areas is a plus. Technical and Analytical Skills Highly proficient in Excel (i.e. pivot tables, formulas) and other Microsoft Office applications. Aptitude to learn new technologies and systems used to pull and analyze data including Tableau, Alteryx and account specific vendor data portals. Strong data manipulation, data cleaning and data visualization skills for summarizing large data sets in order to facilitate decision making and strategic planning Programming experience in any language (R, Python, SQL etc) is a plus Communication and Time Management Curious, quick learner and detail oriented Self-motivated, flexible and able to operate under changing priorities and/or tight timelines Ability to prioritize multiple important projects Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to tell a clear, concise, and actionable story with data Proficient at establishing relationships with cross-functional peers Proactive, positive team-player

They will sit side-by-side with our data scientists and analyze complex business problems, have access to internal and external data sources, and be expected to communicate relevant insights to senior leadership and key decision-makers. Key Qualifications  At least 2-4 yrs experience working as a data/business analyst, auditor/investigator, or related analytic role  Competent with SQL and Python  Experience applying analytical techniques to provide solutions to real business problems  Inquisitiveness and a desire for continued self-improvement and development of new skills  Exceptional interpersonal skills with ability to connect and develop strong partnerships  Strong verbal / written communication skills  Creativity to go beyond current tools to deliver best solution to the problem  Comfort working independently and making key decisions on projects  Ability to tell meaningful and accurate stories with data  Experience eliciting business requirements and executive metrics  Experience building business cases and project plans  Description  • Support discovery of business problems • Analyze and interoperate new sources of data • Perform ad-hoc and reoccurring statistical analyses • Work with data warehouse architects and software developers to generate seamless business intelligence solutions for business partners • Present results of analyses to business units  Education & Experience  Bachelors / Masters in a quantitative field (Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, etc.) or equivalent experience Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. Senior Machine Learning Scientist  Atomwise is the leading artificial intelligence (AI) drug discovery company, based in San Francisco, CA. We discover and develop small molecules that will improve human health and agricultural productivity.  Our team has over 35 Ph.D. scientists who contribute to a collaborative academic-like culture that fosters robust scientific and technical discussion. We strongly believe that data wins over opinions, and aim for as little dogma as possible in our decision-making. Our team members have expertise in a wide range of disciplines-from computational chemistry and structural biology to cloud-native best practices-and we regularly have internal seminars open to anyone interested in learning about these topics.  Our ml.research team is responsible for developing new tools and techniques to be used by our applied scientists. We are looking for a senior machine learning scientist with significant research experience to join our team. As a member of our team, you will:   Perform cutting-edge research on topics including generative models, self-supervised learning, out-of-distribution generalization, and structure-based graph neural networks.  Interact with our academic partners to develop and implement new ideas related to structure-based drug discovery.  Write and publish papers resulting from academic collaborations or internal research.  Translate research ideas to our internal framework, and evaluate with a skeptical eye, and deliver new tools to our applied machine learning group.   Our Machine Learning team is small and growing quickly. As a result, there are plenty of opportunities to have a big impact on our success.  Required qualifications:   Ph.D. or M.Sc. in computer science, statistics, data science, or related field  5+ years of extensive practical experience and proven track record of developing, implementing, debugging, and extending machine learning algorithm  Knowledge of modern neural network frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX  Strong analytical and statistical skills  Scientific rigor, healthy skepticism, and detail-orientation in training and analyzing machine learning models  A strong publication record at the intersection of machine learning and biology, chemistry, or physics   Preferred qualifications:   Experience with graph neural network frameworks such as PyTorch Geometric or Deep Graph Library  Familiarity with generative models or self-supervised learning  Understanding of equivariant or other physics-inspired neural networks  Experience with cloud computing environments (AWS/Azure/GCE)   Please apply with a resume and cover letter.  Compensation and Benefits:   Great, world-class team of colleagues – scientists from a variety of backgrounds (chemistry, medicine, biology, physics, CS/ML)  Stock compensation plan – you’ll be an Atomwise co-owner  Platinum health, dental, and vision benefits  401k with 4% match  Funding for professional development and conference attendance  Flexible work schedule  Generous parental leave   Atomwise is an equal opportunity employer and strives to foster an inclusive workplace. Our mission is to develop better medicines faster, and we know that we need a diverse team to develop medicines that serve diverse populations. Accordingly, Atomwise does not make any employment decisions (including but not limited to, hiring, compensation, and promotions) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, and local law.  We strongly encourage people of diverse backgrounds and perspectives to apply.  Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

locations San Jose time type Full time posted on Posted 30+ Days Ago job requisition id R111154 Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. Deep understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, deep learning, or data mining concepts, and a track record of solving problems with these methods. Proficient in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java and C Familiar with one or more machine learning or statistical modeling tools such as R, Matlab and scikit learn Knowledge and experience of working with relational databases and SQL Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability. Excellent communication, relationship skills and a strong team player. Preferred Qualifications Experience with big data techniques (such as Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark) Knowledge of deep learning, experimental design, ANOVA, statistical inference, and multivariate testing Knowledge of numerical or combinatorial optimization

job_title: Product Management Lead, Augmented Analytics, Core Data
job_Description: Minimum qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.  4 years of experience in product management with technical products.  Experience driving elements of the product development lifecycle (i.e., product vision, go-to-market strategy, driving requirements, product launch). Preferred qualifications:  Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Engineering, UX/UI, Program Management, etc.).  Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction.  Experience effectively working with multiple functional areas, such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance, or Marketing.  Ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority.  About the job A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.  Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.  Core Data's Augmented Analytics team focuses on incorporating Google's investments in machine learning to dramatically change the way users derive insights from their data.  As the Lead Product Manager for Core Data Augmented Analytics, you will oversee the current augmented analytics products, as well as strategic partnerships with teams such as Ads, Search, and Google Cloud Platform. The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company. Responsibilities  Manage and grow a team of Product Managers who oversee the portfolio of current Core Data Analysis products and components.  Partner closely with Engineering Leads within Core to define the future vision, strategy, and product offerings for Augmented Analytics at Google.  Collaborate with multiple stakeholders across Google, including senior leaders within Search, Ads, YouTube, Geo and Cloud, to influence infrastructure offerings.  Work cross-functionally across multiple disciplines, including Engineering, UX, Technical Program Management and Customer Engagement, to deliver the best possible user experience and solve business critical infrastructure needs.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

job_title: Sr. Machine Learning Engineer, Search Team
job_Description: Roku is changing how the world watches TV  Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.  From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable — and valued — contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers worldwide while gaining meaningful experience across various disciplines.   Roku's Universal Search team is responsible for voice and text search for content discovery across the Roku streaming platform. Team owns all parts of the search stack, starting from enriching knowledge, search infrastructure, data pipelines, feature stores, machine learning models for retrieval, and ranking personalization.  We are looking for a senior machine learning engineer/tech lead who can build the next generation state of the art search relevance ML. Ideal candidates should have strong expertise and industry experience in one or more of these areas: search ranking ML, auto-complete models, personalized embedding-based retrieval, query understanding, recommendation systems.  What you will do   You will productionalize Search relevance ML models end-to-end starting from data pipelines, model building, model serving, running A/B, and making data-driven optimizations to the models.  You will be a key stakeholder in defining relevance roadmap improvements  You will research and prototype state of the art models, A/B test, and launch search relevance improvements in production by making data-driven decisions.   Qualifications :   5+ years of experience applying Machine Learning to concrete problems, at large-scale  Expertise in machine learning fundamentals, applicable to search - Learning to Rank, Deep Learning, Tree-Based Models, understanding of NLP approaches like W2V or Bert.  Should be able to identify the right KPIs and objective functions.  Expertise in Engineering and CS fundamentals. Should be able to write an algorithm with ease.  Proven work on large-scale search/information retrieval relevance systems.  Familiar and comfortable with cloud deployments (AWS preferred)  MS/Ph.D. Computer Science or related (AI/ML preferred)  The Roku culture  Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We're independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV.  We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002.  If you are results oriented, and are excited by the idea that Roku's success will depend on your ability to deliver cutting edge ML products, then Roku Recommendation team would love to talk to you!

The Data Scientist has a proven ability to analyze complex problems using data and to provide insight to decision-makers. Key responsibilities include accessing data from various sources, building data visualizations and dashboards, interpreting data using statistics, and creating reports that drive critical product improvements and business decisions. The Data Scientist works closely with cross-functional groups to identify process and system performance parameters, design and create methods to extract data, and independently produce reports using appropriate methods. They will develop, maintain and improve processes, tools and reports as needed. This role interfaces and collaborates with scientific and engineering teams for product development, operations and commercial activities. Your key responsibilities Impacts business objectives by conducting data analysis and providing recommendations that impact the direction of strategic and tactical plans Creates new data interrogation approaches and works with large and complex data sets Identifies the bottlenecks of data processing and analysis, proposes and implements solutions such as automating data pipelines and analyses and optimizing database queries Applies the scientific method to generate and test hypotheses using data Applies cutting edge data science concepts from machine learning and deep learning to solve challenging problems Uses tools to aggregate, transform and process data sources to be used for analysis Develops understanding of data structures and metrics as they relate to product performance and manufacturing Creates analyses that integrate information from diverse product elements such as manufacturing processes, materials, device design, sensors, protocols, and instrument software Creates visual representations of data to communicate complex ideas and relationships Communicates results clearly and effectively with reports and presentations through visual displays of quantitative information and articulate interpretations and conclusion. Who you are B.S./M.S./PhD. degree; life science, biochemistry, molecular biology, computational biology, bioengineering, data science, data engineering, or information technology. Knowledge or experience in molecular biology and medical diagnostics, preferred. Data analytics experience in life sciences, healthcare, engineering or related field. Hands-on programming experience with Python or R—including creating functions, classes, and transporting code from exploratory drafts into packages or scripts. Hands-on programming experience with SQL for acquiring and transforming data (Snowflake experience is a plus) Experience in data extraction, mining, cleaning, and summarizing. Experience in querying and manipulating large data sets using data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and utilizing statistical/mathematical software (e.g. Python, R) Demonstrated understanding of statistics and probability fundamentals. Experience with data visualization technologies such as Spotfire, Tableau, Shiny, or Dash Experience with open source tools for data analysis, deep learning and machine learning technology such as pandas, scipy, scikit-learn, Keras, and/or tensorflow, preferred. Good software craftsmanship practices, strong documentation skills, and code version control Who we are At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity. Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Level: Individual contributor

job_title: Full Stack Software Engineer - Machine Learning Infrastructure

job_title: ITSM Program Manager (Open to US Remote)
job_Description: Exabeam is a global cybersecurity leader that adds intelligence to every IT and security stack. The leader in Next-gen SIEM and XDR, Exabeam is reinventing the way security teams use analytics and automation to solve Threat Detection, Investigation, and Response (TDIR), from common security threats to the most critical that are difficult to identify. Exabeam offers a comprehensive cloud-delivered solution that leverages machine learning and automation using a prescriptive, outcomes-based approach to TDIR. We design and build products to help security teams detect external threats, compromised users and malicious adversaries, minimize false positives and best protect their organizations. For more information, visit www.exabeam.com Exabeam is seeking an ITSM Program Manager to drive ITSM disciplines through managing incidents, problems, and change controls so that we maintain an ecosystem of highly supportable and dependable services for our customers. In this role, you will serve as an expert in working with cross-functional teams to ensure project deadlines and objectives are met. You should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, as well as the ability to drive results within the organization.  Responsibilities You will work cross-functionally with members of the Engineering, Product Management, Cloud Ops, and Customer Success teams to drive technical alignment, escalation efficiency, and issue resolution. You will leverage technical and program management skills in the planning, tracking, and reporting of program deliverables. You will properly identify, remediate, communicate, or escalate program risks. You will demonstrate excellent judgment and integrity with the ability to make timely and sound decisions cross-functionally. You will identify opportunities to streamline/optimize current practices in order to shorten delivery schedules, improve quality, and/or increase efficiency. You will aid the stakeholders in managing technical and program changes. You will interact with executives on program roadmaps, goals, and communicate key developments on new projects or critical escalations. You will be data-driven, such to build metrics and dashboards around escalation trends, uncovering early warning signs and providing countermeasures You will own blameless root cause and post mortem analysis You will ensure that customer escalations are updated in a timely manner by engineers  Requirements Bachelors’ degree in a technical field or equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience in Development, Design, Test, Support, or Program Management of a technical product. Exceptional presentation, listening, oral, and written communication skills with various audiences and levels. Ability to effectively interact with individuals and groups at all levels and build rapport with people within and outside the organization. Ability to quickly respond to changes in business scenarios, projects, and resources, adapting positively and promptly. Ability to cut through ambiguity and remain flexible and calm in the face of uncertainty and stress. Experience with software development life cycle and various project methodologies and processes (including Agile/Scrum). Excellence in decision-making, consensus building, and conflict management. Strong sense of urgency, ownership, and willingness to go above and beyond.  Nice to Have Experience in Cyber Security Knowledge of development life cycle and software release processes for both on premise and cloud-based environments PMP, ITIL, SCRUM Master Certifications  Exabeam is privately funded by Blue Owl Capital, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Cisco Investments, Norwest Venture Partners, Acrew Capital, Icon Ventures, and investor Shlomo Kramer. For more information visit https://www.exabeam.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

job_title: Principal Product Manager- Machine Learning Infrastructure
job_Description: You Have:   5+ years of product management experience  ·  3+ years as a PM: we firmly believe that Engineering, Science, TPM and Design experience is valuable for PMs and counts towards time in role  ·  An understanding of ML, and the ability to map customer problems to ML solutions and direct experience working with machine learning teams  ·  Experience delivering a product for technical users — software developers, machine learning practitioners, or data scientists — especially improving the developer experience of using internal tools or software library  ·  Experience working in a startup context, with demonsstrated experience taking product ideas from 0-1  Job summary  About Us: Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch.  About the Role: The Community team builds products that connect 100M+ viewers to millions of live streamers in real time every day. Our technology helps ML engineers train more accurate and reproducible models, and provides product teams the ability to utilize personalization products to improve performance of each community experiences on Twitch. Reporting to the Foundations product director, you will partner with Machine Learning Engineering, Data Science and product teams to build the next generation of machine learning products at Twitch. You'll build trusted relationships with customers to inform prioritization and product roadmaps to support the end-to-end Machine Learning journey. You will also own scaling our existing systems and bringing new products to market from 0-1.  You Will:   Partner with our information, search and recommendations leads to define the future ML functionality for community Foundations  ·  Prioritize requests across internal and external stakeholders based on the future vision of the ML platform within the Foundations team, of which you will define.  ·  Gather user feedback and usage data to understand their goals and needs, validate product assumptions, and communicate requirements  ·  Collaborate with engineers to manage scope and maintain a healthy balance between velocity and quality for new features  ·  Strategize about roadmap decisions, discuss high-level vision, and share insights from your experience in the machine learning space   Perks:   Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance  401(k)  Maternity & Parental Leave  Flexible PTO  Amazon Employee Discount  Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch.
